org.sadun.util
Class BaseObjectWithId

java.lang.Object
  org.sadun.util.BaseObjectWithId
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectWithId, java.io.Serializable
public abstract class BaseObjectWithId
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, ObjectWithId

A base implementation of ObjectWithId.

This partial implementation stores the object id in the protected field #id, and can be used both for classes requiring id based equality only or requring also type-equality.

It also provides a default ObjectWithIdMetadata in #metadata, defininig:

  • the metadata (that is, a string with which every id must start) by

    • creating an acronym of the unqualified class name, keeping only the uppercase letters;
      for example, foo.MyClass has MC as acronym;

    • if the acronym built with the rule above is the empty string, the first three letters (or less if there are less available) of the unqualified className are used.

    Subclasses may set #metadata independently in a static intializer; if the id prefix is set to null, no check is made on the id pattern when a new object is constructed.

    Author:
    Cristiano Sadun

    Field Detail

    objectWithIdMetadataMap

    protected static transient java.util.Map objectWithIdMetadataMap

    objectId

    protected java.lang.String objectId
    The id of the object.

    Constructor Detail

    BaseObjectWithId

    protected BaseObjectWithId(java.lang.String id,
                           boolean requireSameTypeForEquality)
    Create an instance of the class with the given id which will or will not perform a type comparison in the equals(Object) method, depending on the value of the requireSameTypeForEquality parameter.

    Unless #metadata returns a null id prefix, the constructor also checks that the given id matches the class (see class comment).

    Parameters:
    id - the unique id of the object
    requireSameTypeForEquality - if true, equals(Object) will perform also a type comparsino besides an id comparison.

    BaseObjectWithId

    protected BaseObjectWithId(java.lang.String id)
    Create an instance with the given id and which will equate only to object of the same type.

    Unless #metadata is null, the constructor also checks that the given id matches the class id prefix (see class comment).

    Parameters:
    id - the unique id of the object
    Method Detail

    checkPrefix

    protected void checkPrefix(java.lang.String id,
                           ObjectWithIdMetadata metadata)
    This method is used at construction to verify whether the given id is suitable for the object, and shoud throw an IllegalArgumentException if it not.

    This method can be overridden by subclasses.

    This implementation accepts only prefixes which start with the id prefix specified by the metadata.

    Parameters:
    metadata - the metadata for the object
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the id is invalid.

    getId

    public java.lang.String getId()
    Return the unique id of the object.

    Specified by:
    getId in interface ObjectWithId
    Returns:
    an id for an object.
    See Also:
    ObjectWithId.getId()

    equals

    public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
    Verifies if two object are the same, by comparing their ids. Depending on the at construction parameter requireSameTypeForEquality, the comparison may also require that the compared object has the same class as this object.

    Parameters:
    obj - the object to compare
    Returns:
    if the given object is equalt to this object

    equalWithNoObjectWithId

    protected boolean equalWithNoObjectWithId(java.lang.Object obj)
    Subclasses may override this method to implement an equality check with some other type than ObjectWithId.

    This implementation returns false.

    Parameters:
    obj - the object to compare (which is not an ObjectWithId.
    Returns:
    false.

    hashCode

    public final int hashCode()
    Return an hash code for the object, obtained by its id.

    an hash code for the object, obtained by its id.
